commu.name: core
commu.label: Communication
commu.description: A communications specialist can operate all shipboard and personal communication gear with precisian, attempt to decipher coded communication signals, code outgoing messages, jam external communication and sensor signals, and try to over- come jamming from an outside source.

defen.name: core
defen.label: Defences
defen.description: A defences specialist can operate all shipboard defensive systems with precision, attempt to direct defences to parts of the ship where they're most needed, and analyze attack patterns to make best use of the defences his ship possesses. In space vehicle combat, the defences operator can provide a penalty to an opponent's weapons or sensors during any given attack

engin.name: core
engin.label: Engineering
engin.description: An engineering specialist moni torso ship's electronic and mechanical systems as a whole, watching for fluctuations and other signs that a component is breaking down. He can institute repairs to damaged systems from his station, route power to sperific systems, and direct hands-on repairs at remote locations.

senso.name: core
senso.label: Sensors
senso.description: A sensors specialist can operate all shipboard and personal sensor gear with precision, attempt to scan ships or planets, and analyze those readings in a short period of time. He can use the data to provide bonuses to a weapons or defences operator.

weapo.name: core
weapo.label: Weapons
weapo.description: A weapons specialist can operate all shipboard weapons systems with precision. In starship combat, the weapons operator picks targets and makes attacks.

tacti.name: core
tacti.label: Tactics
tacti.description: This broad skill provides a hero with basic training in and an understanding of tactics and tactical situations. While tactics may come into play in many types of situations, it's most commonly used during infantry combat, space combat, and vehicle combat. A successful use of the skill provides a penalty to the opponent's next skill check, indicating that yon developed a tactical plan and successfully employed it against him. Check results: On a Critical Failure, the opponent sees through your intentions and receives a 1 bonus; failure, no modifier to the opponent's next skill check; Ordinary, +1 penalty lo opponent's next skill check: Good. *2; and Amazing, +3,

infan.name: core
infan.label: Infantry
infan.description: The infantry tactics skill covers battlefield strategies when the main component of the battle is individual troops.

space.name: core
space.label: Space
space.description: The space tactics skill covers battlefield strategies when spaceships engage in combat.

technsc.name: core
technsc.label: Technical Science
technsc.description: This skill represents a hero's training in the technical sciences, including the maintenance, repair, and inven- tion of mechanical and electronic de- vices (not including computers), and gen e ra 1 technical knowledge . Skill checks made to determine if a character knows a certain piece of technical information, or it he's able to research a question and discover an answer, are made the same way as Knowledge skill checks; see the description of that skill on page 81 for details. This skill is necessary for a character to use certain sophisticated or po- tentially dangerous tools, such as a cutting torch (see page 140 in Chapter 9: Good's & Services) without risking personal injury or damage fa the tool.

inven.name: core
inven.label: Invention
inven.description: Invention lets cr hero build an elec- tronic or mechanical component or syslem from scratch, or to modify an existing device to perform a new 1 unction. Using this skill requires time; ri- ven bon checks are always complex skill checks. Modifying an existing item may be able to be done in rounds, under the right conditions, but all other aspects of invention re- quire hours, days, weeks, or months depending on the determination at the Gamemaster.

juryr.name: core
juryr.label: Juryrig
juryr.description: This skill enables a hero to make fast, patchwork repairs in order to get an electronic or mechanical de- vice or system up and running for a short period of lime, A juryrig repair, even when successful, adds diificul ty to the lull repairs that must be made later, but it con get a hero through a sticky situation, A jujyng repair can be made suc- cessfully once on a speed ic system or item. If it breaks down after being juryrlgged, the system or item won't work again until its completely fixed (using Technical Science-repair). Making a juryrig skill check is a single action, but a character who tries to use this skill must do so on his tirsl available action in a round, and he can't attempt any other ac- tions for the rest of the round. Haw long the juryrigging lasts, and the amount ot dilficulty added to the full repairs, depend on tin- result at the skill check; On a Critical Failure, the system or item becomes unusable and can't be made functional again without full repairs.             On a Failure, the jury riq attempt doesn't work but can be tried egain.             On an Ordinary success, the sys- tem or item becomes operational tor d6+l time units, and. 3 more success- es are needed (in addition to those that were already required, based on how severely the item was damaged) to make full repairs.             On a Good success, tire system or item becomes operational for 2d4+2 time units, and 2 more successes are needed to make full repairs. CO             On an Amazing success, the sys- tern or item becomes operational for 3d4+2 time units, and 1 more success is needed to make full repairs,             Improved Jury rig: When a hero reaches rank 6 r his ability improves as follows: An Ordinary success pro- duces <i Good result (as described above), a Good success produces an Amazing result, and an Amazing success means the juryrigging works so well that the system or item is considered to be repaired and in reg- ular working order.
